problem_text: m \angle BDK = 3x+4, m \angle JDR = 5x-10, find the measurement of \angle KDR.
logic_forms: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(B, D, K)), MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: K on DE, ∠BDA, ∠KDF, 3.14 = pi, ∠KDB, R on AD, B on DF, ∠ADE, pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = ∠KDB, ∠KDB = ∠RDJ, ∠ADK, pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠RDJ, ∠EDF, AD ⊥ BD

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on DF, ∠KDF
Conclusions: ∠KDB = ∠KDF

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : R on AD, ∠ADE
Conclusions: ∠ADE = ∠RDE

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ADE, K on DE
Conclusions: ∠ADE = ∠ADK

Step 5:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠ADK, ∠KDB, ∠BDA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ADK + ∠BDA + ∠KDB

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : R on AD, ∠ADK
Conclusions: ∠ADK = ∠RDK

Step 7:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠RDJ, ∠KDB = ∠RDJ
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠EDF, K on DE
Conclusions: ∠EDF = ∠KDF

Step 9:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AD ⊥ BD
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠BDA

Step 10:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADE = ∠RDE, ∠ADK = ∠RDK, ∠ADE = ∠ADK
Conclusions: ∠RDE = ∠RDK

Step 11:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KDB = ∠KDF, pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDF

Step 12:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = ∠KDB, pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB
Conclusions: pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180)

Step 13:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RDE = ∠RDK, ∠ADK = ∠RDK
Conclusions: ∠ADK = ∠RDE

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EDF = ∠KDF, pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDF
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF

Step 15:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠BDA, 2 * pi = ∠ADK + ∠BDA + ∠KDB, ∠ADK = ∠RDE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠KDB + ∠RDE

Step 16:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF, 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180)

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180), pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180)

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180), pi * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB

Step 20:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = pi * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180), 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180)

Step 21:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) = ∠KDB, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠KDB + ∠RDE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) + ∠RDE

Step 22:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠RDE = ∠RDK, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180) + ∠RDE, 3.14 * ((4 + 3 * x) / 180) = 3.14 * ((5 * x - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: 1.13 = ∠RDK
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(K, D, B)), MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(K, D, B)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(3.0, x), 4.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)), Mul(pi, Div(Sub(Mul(5.0, x), 10.0), 180.0)))
